name: Talus Flow
description: The Talus Flow resembles a pile of rocks and scree, adept at blending into rocky environments. It uses its bulk and natural features to surprise unsuspecting foes.
memorable: It can disguise itself as a rocky surface, providing surprise attacks, while controlling the battlefield with terrain manipulation abilities.
goals: To ambush unsuspecting creatures and control the battlefield through tactical maneuvering.
relations: May be found in rocky terrains alongside other earth-based elementals.
environment: Typically found in rocky or mountainous regions.
strengths: High Strength and Constitution scores, significant condition immunities, and abilities to control space.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to thunder damage and has average Dexterity, making it less agile.
attacks: Multiattack with powerful Slam attacks that can grapple and potentially incapacitate foes.
most_powerful_ability: Scree Form allows it to disrupt and control the movement of enemies, making it difficult terrain.
senses: It has tremorsense out to 120 feet, allowing it to detect creatures through vibrations in the ground.
skills: Possesses a +1 bonus in perception, giving it a slight edge in noticing potential threats.
additional_information: Immune to conditions like exhaustion, paralyzed, and poisoned.
Ability to regain hit points by damaging creatures in close combat.
Can move through very narrow spaces, enhancing its ambush capabilities.
Advantage on Stealth checks made in rocky terrain.
Landslide ability can knock creatures prone, providing tactical advantages.
test_queries: monster that can knock enemies prone
